video.title: Create A Twitter Bot With Python
video.description:
Create a Twitter bot with Python that tweets images or status updates at a set interval. The Python script also scrapes the web for data.

💻Code: https://github.com/jg-fisher/theModelBot

Tutorial created by John G. Fisher. Watch more great tutorial from John on his YouTube channel:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoMAKPDECRWb7GEWF1lQZMQ

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: John G. Fisher
topLevelComment.text: Thanks for sharing this Beau. Any questions you guys might have leave them below and I'll get back to you asap!

topLevelComment.author: Wagner Rosa
topLevelComment.text: Great video. Just a note, when you use “with” to open a file, it automatically closes it after the operation, so you don’t need to write f.close(). Cheers!

topLevelComment.author: Rick Johnson
topLevelComment.text: Thanks for a real-world short example! That said, it must be said: / is slash or forward slash. \ is backslash.  URLs use forward slash, Windows drive paths and escaped chars use backslash.

topLevelComment.author: Adil Saju
topLevelComment.text:
Just please write 
f.write(source.content) instead of f.write(requests.get(url).content)

topLevelComment.author: Muzik Jamz
topLevelComment.text:
In your image scraping code.  The line where you have f.write(request.get(url).content... 

Why not have f.write(source.content...

You already have the response when you ran request the first time, there is not need to run it again. Is that not a bit inefficient?

topLevelComment.author: Kevin McLeod
topLevelComment.text: I have been working on this now for two days and still cant get it to work. I am on a ubuntu 18.04 laptop and used gedit to make my two files. I have already made my twitter bot and setup the api keys needed. but I dont know how to execute my code. I have tried pycharm and bluefish but keep getting errors or nothing at all happens. Is there a missing step not covered in the video?

replies.author: Kevin McLeod
replies.text: @Aleksandar Magdenovski Thanks I'll give this a try.

replies.author: Aleksandar Magdenovski
replies.text: Had the same problem on windows, couldn't execute the program. Turns out you need to execute(run) the program through the command prompt/console. The program wouldn't run for me when trying to get it to work in PyCharm. Hopefully this helps you out.

replies.author: c_a

replies.author: Amal Vijayan
replies.text:
soup.findAll() cant find any img tags. It returns values for other html tags like div or script.

Here is what i tried : 

image_tags = soup.findAll('img')
print(image_tags)
o/p---> []
however it returns values for
image_tags = soup.findAll(''div')

Also I managed to get the image by using direct url of an image
